intro: Psychotria caquetensis, commonly known as the Caqueté psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the Amazon rainforests of Colombia and is characterized by its striking violet to purple flowers. The plant typically grows as an erect shrub, reaching heights of up to 2 meters, with opposite, elliptical leaves. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in the understory of tropical forests. The genus Psychotria is known for containing various psychoactive compounds, though the specific chemical composition of P. caquetensis remains under study.
